credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Fame with Trumpet, Sala di Recezione, Palazzo Quirinale, Rome
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
medium: Pen and dark gray ink, brush and color washes over black chalk ruled lines on beige wove paper
description: On either side of central candelabrum, flying Fame holding garland in one hand and blowing trumpet with other. Ruled chalk lines in black chalk suggest square molding.
name: Drawing
